Vacations
In general, the following vacation periods, with pay, per year, will he
allowed for the positions indicated:
One month (23 working days):
President
Administrative Vice President
Network Manager
Publications Editor
Staff Associate
Three weeks (15 working days):
Assistant Network Manager for Production
Secretary to the President
Two weeks (10 working days):
All other salaried employees not listed above. Hourly
employees will not normally receive vacation credit.
Modifications of the above may be made by the President, with the approval
of the Board of Directors.
Each employee shall be credited with vacation earned on the first and each
â€¢u.cceeding anniversary of the date of employment. Vacation may be taken
at times mutually agreeable to the employee and the proper administrative
officer(s) of the Association concerned, except that no employee shall
normally be entitled to take any vacation during the first six months of
employment.
Upon termination of employment, for any reason, an employee shall be entitled
to receive cash remuneration for any unused vacation, based on the rate of
pay at the time the employment is terminated.
Disability Leave
Disability leave accumulates at the rate of one working day with pay for
each month of service (up to an accumulated credit of 45 days) and is
available each month to be used as necessary. Any employee who has accrued
a credit of 45 days shall receive credit for only one-half day per month
thereafter.
